full_text: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-J DATE: 08/10/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 1201 1206 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 8:00-8:30 AM 4:00-4:30 PM 12:30- 1:00 AM 1239 1238 8:30- 9:00 AM 4:30-5:00 PM 1:00-1:30 AM 1207 1208 9:00-9:30 AM 5:00 -5:30 PM 1:30-2:00 AM 1235 1235 9:30-10:00 AM 5:30-6:00 PM 2:00-2:30 AM 1205 1205 10:00-10:30 AM 6:00-6:30 PM 2:30-3:00 AM 1249 1249 10:30-11:00 AM 6:30-7:00 PM 3:00-3:30 AM 1205 1216 11:00-11:30 AM 7:00-7:30 PM 3:30-4:00 AM 1239 1240 11:30-12:00 AM 7:30-8:00 PM 4:00-4:30 AM 1412 1413 12:00-12:30 PM 8:00-8:30 PM 4:30-5:00 AM 1346 1346 12:30- 1:00 PM 8:30- 9:00 PM 5:00 -5:30 AM 1504 1505 1:00-1:30 PM 9:00-9:30 PM 5:30-6:00 AM 1534 1538 1:30-2:00 PM 9:30-10:00 PM 6:00-6:30 AM 1619 1624 2:00-2:30 PM 10:00-10:30 PM 6:30-7:00 AM 2:30-3:00 PM 10:30-11:00 PM 7:00-7:30 AM 3:00-3:30 PM 11:00-11:30 PM 7:30-8:00 AM 3:30-4:00 PM 11:30-12:00 PM MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN DOJ-OGR-00026754

text_blocks.content: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-J DATE: 08/10/2019
TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE
MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

additional_notes: The document contains handwritten entries in the check sheet table and a redacted signature. The document is stamped with 'MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT' on both top corners.
